Description: A Phoenician amphora of red siltware pottery, with a pointed base, convex sides, and sharp shoulder carination. Above the latter the sides converge to a contracted mouth, surrounded by a low, rounded rim. There is a loop-handle on either side at the shoulder. The exterior bears remains of a pale pink slip.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 2
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 2 is pencilled on the object. See also London, BM, EA 22332.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 4)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.112, p.199, pl.41, p.221, pl.63)
